required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Staging Classification of Severe Tricuspid Regurgitation Using Novel Cardiac Imaging Techniques
clinical_study.official_title: Staging Classification of Severe Tricuspid Regurgitation Using Novel Cardiac Imaging Techniques

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to assess the severity of tricuspid regurgitation (a disorder in which the tricuspid valve in the heart does not close tight enough) using cardiac magnetic resonance imaging (MRI).

detailed_description.textblock: 40 patients with moderate or more TR on echocardiography will undergo CMR/MRE with contrast to assess TR severity, and the associated extra-valvular cardiac and liver abnormalities as shown in the flow diagram below. Patients will continue their clinical management by their primary physicians as per the standards of care. 1-year follow up will be conducted via phone to inquire about patient's vital status (dead/alive), symptoms and hospitalizations.

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Severity of tricuspid regurgitation by cardiac magnetic resonance imaging
primary_outcome.description: Incidence of severity of TR by CMR as compared with current gold standard (TTE)

secondary_outcome.measure: Correlation between severity of Tricuspid regurgitation by cardiac magnetic resonance imaging vs. elastography
secondary_outcome.description: Correlation between severity of TR by CMR vs. echocardiography with 1-year composite endpoint of death, heart failure hospitalization, or tricuspid valve surgery.

arm_group.description: 40 patients with moderate or more TR on echocardiography will undergo CMR/MRE with contrast to assess TR severity, and the associated extra-valvular cardiac and liver abnormalities. Patients will continue their clinical management by their primary physicians as per the standards of care. 1-year follow up will be conducted via phone to inquire about patient's vital status (dead/alive), symptoms and hospitalizations.

intervention.description: a non-invasive assessment to determine severity of tricuspid regurgitation

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Moderate or more tricuspid regurgitation
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Prior tricuspid valve prosthesis
2. Pacemaker/defibrillator that would impede MRI imaging
3. Planned tricuspid valve surgery
4. Primary liver pathology
